ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Does man imagine We will not reassemble his bones?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Does man think We shall not put his bones together?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Does man imagine that We will not be able to bring his bones together again?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Do men think that We shall never be able to assemble their bones?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Does man assume that We will never assemble his bones?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Does man think that We shall not assemble his bones
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Does man think that We shall not gather his bones?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: What, does man reckon We shall not gather his bones?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Thinketh man that We shall not assemble his bones?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Does man think that We cannot [resurrect him and] bring his bones together again?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Deemest man that We shall not assemble his bones?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Does man suppose that We will not put together his bones [at resurrection]?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Does man think that We cannot assemble his bones?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Does man (a disbeliever) think that We shall not assemble his bones?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: What, does the human think We shall never gather his bones?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Does man think that We will not reassemble his bones?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Does man think that We will not assemble his bones?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [75:3] Does man, that is, [does] the disbeliever, suppose that We shall not assemble his bones?, for the raising [from the graves] and [for] the bringing back to life.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Thinketh man) does the disbelieving man, 'Adiyy Ibn Rabi'ah, think because he did not believe in the resurrection (that We shall not assemble his bones) that We are not able to gather his bones after they scatter, change and turn into dust?
